intro: Nesaea lythroides, commonly known as the redstem sandmat, is a low-growing perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often covered with a fine layer of wax, helping to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Nesaea lythroides is well adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in areas with low rainfall.
